elements.title: Eberhard Zeidler
elements.contents: ... that Eberhard Zeidler envisaged Toronto Eaton Centre (pictured), which opened 45 years ago today, to be an "interior street" instead of simply a shopping mall?

elements.title: Broadhurst
elements.contents: ... that New York City's Broadhurst, Plymouth, Shubert, and Booth Theatres were all designed with curved corners facing Broadway?

elements.title: Holger Mühlbauer
elements.contents: ... that Holger Mühlbauer, who currently serves as the managing director of the German IT security association TeleTrusT, originally trained as a metalworker?

elements.title: Lake Worth Beach, Florida
elements.contents: ... that the annual street painting festival in downtown Lake Worth Beach, Florida, attracts approximately 100,000 people?

elements.title: Marguerite Gautier-van Berchem
elements.contents: ... that Swiss archaeologist Marguerite Gautier-van Berchem created a service for the International Committee of the Red Cross to help prisoners of war from the French colonies during World War II?

elements.title: WSWG
elements.contents: ... that a 1971 format change and firing of three Black disc jockeys contributed to the Mississippi radio station WSWG losing its broadcast license?

elements.title: Jonathan Cooper
elements.contents: ... that British barrister Jonathan Cooper was "at the forefront of efforts to decriminalise homosexuality around the world"?

elements.title: Slutty Vegan
elements.contents: ... that the act of trying a burger at Slutty Vegan for the first time is known as being "sluttified"?
